A Prayer of David. Bow down thine ear, O LORD, hear me: for I <FI>am<Fi> poor and needy.<RF>A Prayerâ€¦: or, A Prayer, being a Psalm of David<Rf>
Preserve my soul; for I <FI>am<Fi> holy: O thou my God, save thy servant that trusteth in thee.<RF>holy: or, one whom thou favourest<Rf>
Be merciful unto me, O Lord: for I cry unto thee daily.<RF>daily: or, all the day<Rf>
Rejoice the soul of thy servant: for unto thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.
For thou, Lord, <FI>art<Fi> good, and ready to forgive; and plenteous in mercy unto all them that call upon thee.
Give ear, O LORD, unto my prayer; and attend to the voice of my supplications.
In the day of my trouble I will call upon thee: for thou wilt answer me.<CM>
Among the gods <FI>there is<Fi> none like unto thee, O Lord; neither <FI>are there any works<Fi> like unto thy works.
All nations whom thou hast made shall come and worship before thee, O Lord; and shall glorify thy name.
For thou <FI>art<Fi> great, and doest wondrous things: thou <FI>art<Fi> God alone.
Teach me thy way, O LORD; I will walk in thy truth: unite my heart to fear thy name.
I will praise thee, O Lord my God, with all my heart: and I will glorify thy name for evermore.
For great <FI>is<Fi> thy mercy toward me: and thou hast delivered my soul from the lowest hell.<RF>hell: or, grave<Rf>
O God, the proud are risen against me, and the assemblies of violent <FI>men<Fi> have sought after my soul; and have not set thee before them.<RF>violent: Heb. terrible<Rf>
But thou, O Lord, <FI>art<Fi> a God full of compassion, and gracious, longsuffering, and plenteous in mercy and truth.
O turn unto me, and have mercy upon me; give thy strength unto thy servant, and save the son of thine handmaid.
Shew me a token for good; that they which hate me may see <FI>it<Fi>, and be ashamed: because thou, LORD, hast holpen me, and comforted me.<CM>
